website_summaries.verdict: Powers through grass with ease thanks to innovative twin blade design.
pros: Twin blade system offers good width of cut and superior mulching, without straining the motor
2 battery ports enable the mower to automatically switch to the backup when main battery drains, thus providing extended run time
cons: Great for lawn maintenance, but struggles with long, thick grass

customer_reviews.title: Great mower. I bought this for a new house ...
customer_reviews.text: Great mower. I bought this for a new house with a large yard. Old house was on a very small lot and I had an under powered worx 24v mower. It got the job done but lacked power to mulch well. This 40v mower is really powerful. Did my 1/3 acre yard with 1/2 battery to spare cutting at the lowest deck height to get rid of last years thatch. It was plenary powerful and mulched incredibly well. My fears this would be under powered and that I'd need gas are totally wrong.
customer_reviews.author: M. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this mower
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mower after reading many positive reviews on Amazon and other sites. I have two major problems with this mower. First, there is a gap between the two blades so you wind up with a narrow strip of grass that is not cut with each pass of the mower. Second, the bag hangs too low on the mower and will scrape the ground as it collects grass. My garden home lawn was being cut today. Both fully charged batteries died when only 60% of the lawn was cut. Do yourself a favor and buy another battery powered mower.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Trexler

customer_reviews.title: This lawn mower was on recall and took over 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: This lawn mower was on recall and took over 4 weeks for repair. The batteries also can't be left on the charger long term, as the charger won't shut off automatically. The declining performance of the batteries hurt the mower in year two. The mower works well to start with.
customer_reviews.author: dschnied

customer_reviews.title: EASY LAWNMOWER FOR SENIORS
customer_reviews.text: Great product for us - no more dragging electric lines. Runs on charged batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma and Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: Makes mowing a pleasure again
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of mows I must say I love this mower. It’s light, quieter then a gas mower, and best of all I’m not inhaling pollution on a hot summer’s day. Trick I find is to not rush the mowing. Just because this mower is so light, don’t get tempted to jog and mow at the same time. Your lawn will get a bad haircut if you rush it. The twin blade system is interesting and I find myself using a slightly different mowing technique, more straight lines and fewer sharp turns. No issues with battery life. We have small block under quarter acre. Charge time is good. A couple of hours and it’s100%.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Simple Toolless Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I had to exchange the original mower. It was made in 2018 and the new one was made in 2020 along with the batteries. No issues with the new mower. It works much better than the other one that was shipped. It works as expected. Large battery lasts 20 minutes of non-stop usage. The batteries charge in about 30 minutes with this newer model while the 2018 took many hours to charge the large battery. Very simple to operate. The only CON was that the original had to be returned, but am very happy they sent a 2020 model\batteries with the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: johnj_01201

customer_reviews.title: Great Mower
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry to give this great mower only 3 points. It works like a dream. Seems to be powerful enough to handle my relatively flat lawn easily. BUT ... I've contacted their support (by email, they don't answer phone calls because of COVID-19) about a red light that comes on when I start the mower. Usually a red light is an alert of some type. My first email was auto-answered with a reference tag and message that they will get back to me. Two weeks later I sent a follow-up. Three days later still no response. Fortunately the mower runs flawlessly, but I can't fully support a product that has no customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Nick1010

customer_reviews.title: Just do it.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about paying over $300 for an electric mower. I used to run a summer lawn business with gas mowers and trimmers. I couldn't believe an electric could do the job. Boy, was I wrong! We have about a 1/4 acre lot in a residential neighborhood. A few small hills. This thing has worked like a champ with zero issues for 3 years straight! The only thing I've done is replaced the twin blades each year for $15. It's fantastic. Does the whole lawn with both batteries fully charged. I'll never go back to gas again! (The only thing I would consider in the future is getting a self-propelled model.)
customer_reviews.author: MusicTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Stripped Bolt and Screw CAM Lock
customer_reviews.text: Was excited about using our new lawnmower loved the reviews, however, the thread on the bolt of the handle was stripped so couldn’t use it. We had to send back to Amazon for another lawnmower replacement, part not available for 5-7 days. Will reorder and update my review. **** UPDATE- Love it!! Easy to use and assemble. It does the trick! Very quiet! ***** UPDATE - 6 months later 3rd lawnmower. Manufacture defect had to get another NEW one from Manufacturer. CAM lock defective which holds the handles in place.
customer_reviews.author: TGram

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this lawn mower a little over a year. And mowed July-September in 2018. And April-now this year. And once a week in those time frames. It will cut out if any part of your grass is a little too long and you will have to restart it. On top of that, it’s battery powered and smoke started coming from it today. We bought it on sale for $236 last year. And are now having to purchase another lawn mower. Ridiculous. Don’t buy this. My parents have the same one. Theirs lasted a full two years but they are having to buy a new one now too.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Artman

customer_reviews.title: I may have bought the wrong mower
customer_reviews.text: I have a rather small yard (5800 sq ft/Homeadvisor.com says average is about 11,000 sq ft for my state) and the batteries' charge only last long enough to mow the front yard and a quarter of the back yard or vice versa. Then the batteries need to charge for many hours (usually overnight) and I finish the rest the next day. That's my only complaint about this mower. It's possible I have faulty batteries, but this is my experience. The batteries are very expensive in relation to the entire mower so it doesn't make very much sense in spending half the mower's price for two additional batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this mower, it has great power and gets the job done. Really though, I want to talk about the customer service. My lawnmower broke after 3 years and 11 months of use. I contacted the company and they made the warranty process so easy and honored the 4 year warranty by sending me a brand new mower (because I live more than 40 miles from the nearest repair place). It took just a few emails and they didnt ask for any ridiculous troubleshooting or information on my end. Im really impressed with the mower and how Greenworks stood by their product when there was a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Fields

customer_reviews.title: I checked the Manual and it recommended New Starter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this during the Winter . In the Spring I Mowed my small yard 3 times . Today on the 4th time to use this Mower it would NOT Start . The Mower would initially Start than Immediately Die . The Batteries were Fully Charged. There was nothing impeding the Mowers Blades. Just would Not Start . I checked the Manual and it recommended New Starter . I am VERY Unhappy with this particular Greenworks Product and would NOT Recommend it's purchase . I could have purchased 2 Gas Mowers, that Work, for the Price I paid for this Model
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Churchwell

customer_reviews.title: Not as described, returning
customer_reviews.text: Have to mow twice on entire yard and some spots a third. Pushes the grass over so some grass doesn't get cut. Not strong enough to suck up the mowed debris that isn't grass, ie leaves . Don't waste your money or time. Returning
customer_reviews.author: James W

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks lawnmower stopped working - terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Greenworks lawnmower stopped working and when I called customer service they left me on hold for a very long time and so I submitted an online inquiry and they never even responded. I tried taking the lawnmower to a small engine repair person and he said it would cost more to fix then replace the engine. I'd recommend purchasing from somewhere local that can service when you will eventually need it. It worked fine until then but didn't last as I had hoped. Unfortunately I had purchased back up batteries as well but now I don't trust the brand to get another mower.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoCC

customer_reviews.title: An excellent mower for seniors and kids who have to mow the lawn. ;-)
customer_reviews.text: As a 72-year-old woman I was to the point of giving up my gasoline-powered mower because of the difficulty with starting it. This mower starts like a dream! No more shoulder and elbow pain! The cut isn't as "sharp" as the gas mower and it isn't self-propelled. But it is so light and easy to handle, that is not a problem. My yard is an average 1970s tract-house-size yard and I have no problem finishing the mowing and doing the trimming and edging with one charge on the batteries. I'm very pleased with this product. After a few months of using it, I like it even more!
customer_reviews.author: Mary W Frank

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for a women!
customer_reviews.text: Purchase for the new season and have used 2 times. Did want front wheel drive due to lot having a slight slope. But this mower is lightweight and did not have a problem pushing uphill. Easy to put together and charge the batteries, which had sufficient life to cut my 1/2 acre lot. Was tired of gas mowers that would not start, so very happy that this starts with a push of a button. Really quiet. Highly recommend for women!!
customer_reviews.author: CStep

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU LIVE IN FLORIDA.
customer_reviews.text: This lawn mower will not get you through the front and back lawn. The blades come very dull. It will not cut the grass seed stalks. If the grass is too high (haven't mowed for two weeks) the batteries will drain very fast....like you wont make it through the front yard fast. Also if you try to put the batteries on the charger after mowing they will not charge. I find you have to put them in the freezer for about ten minutes they will charge again but thats very frustrating when your front lawn is half mowed. Ok, so it is very light and it would be good for a small lawn.
customer_reviews.author: CJP

customer_reviews.title: just not powerful enough, batteries don't last long enough
customer_reviews.text: i'm moving back to a gas mower after a few seasons with this, after the 4AH battery died out. it was fine for a while, but pretty disappointing that (1) the batteries barely have enough juice for my very small lawn and (2) the cut just isn't great. I really wanted to love this thing. But I'm not spending $100 on a replacement battery for a mower that never worked that great in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Stensrud

customer_reviews.title: 69 years old and still blessed to be able to take care of mowing.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely am so satisfied with this mower and look forward to mowing the grass even in the heat and humidity of Mississippi! The Ion batteries are easily charged and last approximately 45 minutes. Now if I were a few years younger I could cut it all but in the heat and humidity I do the front yard and the next day the back yard. I would recommend this mower to anyone at any age. It was all put together I only had to charge the batteries and lift up the handle to it full position and tighten the large holders....easy peasy. You can do this!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou

customer_reviews.title: Take a good look and consider safety. Good looking mower.
customer_reviews.text: I think that battery operated lawnmowers are still a couple of years away. I liked the lightweight but before I had a chance to use it one of the batteries almost exploded while charging. It starting smoking and got very hot. We were about to leave and go out for dinner when I went to check on the battery and charger. I was both shocked at what I saw and blessed that we didn't leave before I checked. I have visited a couple of stores and noticed that the battery operated is not selling that well. I will take another look next year because the lightweight and hopefully performance will both be perfected.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Batteries are worthless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lawnmower on June 29th. Since then, I've used the lawnmore on my .2 acre lot. My complaints are that: 1)The lawnmower draws down the 4.0AH battery first. After the 4.0AH batter dies, the lawnmower will not draw down the 2.0AH battery. 2) The 4.0AH batter that was provided lasts 2/3 less than it used to. Just to mow my lawn, I have to recharge the batter 3 times, which is ridiculous. I don't store the battery in hot weather, so I consider the battery defective. 3) Why does the manufacturer not just supply 2 4.0AH batteries, or 2 2.0AH batteries. Make it consistent!!! In the words of our imbecile president, " DISSAPOINTED!"
customer_reviews.author: Kaizersozei

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product, but the packaging looks so unprofessional
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple Greenworks 40 Max tools. Having overall good and competetive product their packaging is terrible. The product is flimsy enough to be packed very, very well, but no - they just toos everything like a garbage inside, nothing that will hold the parts steady without scratching each other. With Greenworks you are 50/50 lucky - if you will get brand new item from Greenworks warehouse or silently refurbished by Amazon (or thirdparties, no idea) crap like previously heavily used battery, or missing parts, etc. If Greenworks want to stay on the market - they must improve the quality and shipping control.
customer_reviews.author: Amaz0ner

customer_reviews.title: Don't order! Stopped working after 2 weeks! Poor customer support!
customer_reviews.text: When the mower would no longer start, I took it to recommended (and highly rated) local repair shop. They ordered the needed electrical board 3 times. Each time, they received a differently configured part which would not plug into my machine. In other words, there was no standardization in manufacture. It has been over 3 months now. I still have no mower. I have contacted customer support repeatedly, to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Green

customer_reviews.title: It Slices!!!I It Dices!!! It Mulches!!!
customer_reviews.text: First if all, I purchased the 40Ah/20Ah battery option (the dual 4Ah option was not available). The two batteries lasted for 60-70 minutes. First cut of the year after multiple weeks of rain... my grass was over 1 foot tall. The mower cut the grass like it was nothing. Fantastic mulcher - didn't even use the grass bag. Very light weight... easier than pushing my vacuum cleaner. No more pulling the cord or pushing the heavy gas mower. I ordered a Lotive 6Ah battery that fits perfectly. I have a large yard, so the 3rd battery allows me the mow the lawn without waiting for a recharge. This mower is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: K. Slade

customer_reviews.title: It can work with one battery. Recommend to buy an extra  charger
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to receive my new lawnmower. Which after reaching out to customer service arrived before scheduled. Assembly was relatively easy, everything I needed was in the box. The batteries went out on the first charge so had to re charge them again. Maneuvering wasn’t as easy as expect as I’m a petite 5’3 and 112lbs woman. Self propelled helps a lot just have to get use to it. Mows my lawn very well even when high. Just do adjustments on the blades. Didn’t place the bag at first and cleaning was a mess. So I know the second time should be easier. Be careful with sharp plastic edges.
customer_reviews.author: Yani

customer_reviews.title: A great mower that suits our needs!
customer_reviews.text: We've only used it to mow our lawn twice thus far, but this thing is magnificent. Extremely lightweight (even my young teen commented on how easy it was to push up our hill in the backyard), both batteries charged quickly and charge has lasted through two mows thus far, and it's extremely quiet (I told my teen that she could get up at 8 a.m. and mow the lawn this summer without worrying about waking the neighbors). So happy with this purchase, which replaced and aging gas mower that sometimes took 100 cord pulls before it would crank up!
customer_reviews.author: Jaynee

customer_reviews.title: RECALLED AFTER I PURCHASED
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this mower (so far). I have only used it once (on the highest setting for grass height) and it worked like a charm. It's quiet, easy to maneuver and does the job even thru tall grass. UPDATE! I just got a recall notice that says "Cordless Electric Lawn Mowers Recalled Due to Fire Hazard; Made by Hongkong Sun Rise Trading". I had just 1 day left to return it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ababykitty

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help do certain areas that my husband couldn't get to on the riding lawn mower. It is easier on me than using the weed-eater underneath large bushes and most of the ditch-line at the road side. It's easy to turn on its side and clean underneath after each use. The batteries are top quality and last until my job is done. I like the different level adjustments for how tall the grass is. I watched videos on YouTube to see how other people used it before purchasing it for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Junebug

customer_reviews.title: Lawn mower of the future
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first to switch to an electric lawn mower, but now I wonder why it took me so long. This lawn mower has been awesome! Compared to my previous Craftsman internal combustion lawn mower, it is lighter, quieter, and I don't have to worry about filling (or spilling) gasoline all over the place. The batteries are adequate to mow large lawns before being recharged allowing for a seamless mowing experience (I am able to mow my ~9,000 sq ft lawn on a single charge). The bag is a tad on the smaller side and can get filled quickly, but it is a relatively small hindrance in relation to all the benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I really want to love this mower
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this mower. The first time I trimmed my yard I was able to finish with battery power to spare. The next five times I have not been able to finish the job. I have even purchased a third battery thinking it would help. It did not help. My lawn still has a patch that needs to wait until my battery recharges. The frustrating thing is that the mower claims to have 70 minutes of life. I run out of juice in forty five minutes. I have one week left to return this mower. I don't want to, but I am tired of fifty minute job taking two days.
customer_reviews.author: Ericrogg

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this!! I was so excited!! It takes about an hour total for us to mow the front AND back lawn at our house. About .25 acre total of land (minus the house footprint). The batteries are only lasting us about 30 minutes max (usually closer to 20)...with both of them in! We are really frustrated. We start mowing with the electric mower and then we have to finish with the old gas mower (good thing we didn't throw it out). So disappointed. And because we bought it during winter months (to save money), it's outside Amazon's return limits. A waste of over $300.
customer_reviews.author: P31

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks...really well
customer_reviews.text: 1st electric mower. We share it among 3 houses with small yards. It is powerful enough to mulch thick lawn and my neighbor uses the collector to pick up pine needles and leaves. Since you are not supposed to leave the batteries plugged in longer than the charging time, we bought an extra charger on amazon and two countdown timers (like the Stanley 38428 Countdown TImer sold here) and charge both batteries simultaneously for the estimated time they need. Really pleased with the maneuverability and weight. The charge lasts enough so we can do all three lawns. The lower noise is appreciated by everyone. I won't return to gas.
customer_reviews.author: Wayno

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Inefficient!
customer_reviews.text: It’s lightweight but doesn’t propel itself. The batteries last 25-30 minutes and they take minimum 3 hours to charge. It’s incredibly inefficient!! Save your money, get a gasoline mower. I tried buying extra batteries but each one is a whopping $105, so it probably makes more sense to buy another lawn mower. Throwing this thing in the trash. Crazy!
customer_reviews.author: m.ju

customer_reviews.title: The 20" push mower is useless for all but the smallest yards.
customer_reviews.text: The batteries last a fraction of the time that is advertised. There's no way you can cut any decent-sized yard on one charge. Don't be fooled by the positive reviews. Many of them are for a different product in Greenwork's family.
customer_reviews.author: musicCritic

customer_reviews.title: Buy extra batteries.
customer_reviews.text: OK. In defense of this product.. My grass is way high and thick. About.. 43 of an acre and a lot of holes The batteries are over heating and I really need them to last longer. One battery is smaller than the other. They are interchangeable in the slots. So should have both been the same size. I am on day 2 of cutting and still not able to finish the work. Much quite than a gas mower. Much lighter than one too. I think once I get the yard down to normal it won't be as big of an issue. I would advise getting a 2nd set of batteries to resolve this issue. Otherwise I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ponder This

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mower for our needs!
customer_reviews.text: This unit is perfect for our needs. We mow lawns for elderly neighbors and the common area in our section of our over 55 mobile home park. My wife loves to mow and this mower is perfect. No gas, no fumes, no messy oil. The height adjustment is very easy to use. The lowest setting isn’t as low as I’d prefer, but it works for what we’re doing. It cuts beautifully...no cross cutting necessary. We rinse and dry it off, remove the batteries, and fold the handle down so it’ll fit in a closet. The batteries charge up in about one hour. The large battery lasts 42 minutes. The second lasts about 24 minutes. Perfect for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: randy mcvean

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and frequently broken
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Greenworks 4 years ago and have had it in for warranty repair 3 times. The first time something electrical broke. The last two times each of the dual motors has physically broken with the axle and armature slipping out of place. After the second motor broke they replaced the mower but said the replacement is not eligible for any warranty. It worked well and was exactly what I wanted until the parade to the repair shop started. I am not hopeful the replacement will last long. I'm not sure if I just got a lemon, but I would not buy a Greenworks mower again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Larson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is dreadful
customer_reviews.text: I had an electric Greenworks for years. Loved it. That thing worked so much better then this one. I decided to upgrade to no cord since that was the only thing I didn’t like about it. First off, the batteries only last 15 minutes each!!! And take hours to recharge. It has taken me 4 tries to mow my less than 1/4 acres. Also if you live in the south do not buy this. The batteries can’t work in the heat. They just stop then won’t recharge till they cool down. Third, you have to mow most sections twice because of the dual blades.... I honestly can’t believe all the great reviews of this thing. Utter frustration here.
customer_reviews.author: goongirl

customer_reviews.title: Best thing to ever happen to my lawn
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for two years now and it's still a work horse of a product. I have a very large back yard as well as front yard and 30 yard long by 15 feet wide grass on each side of the house. And the sidewalk grass on the front and side of the house because I have a corner lot. It gets the entire job done in under an hour for me. Gas mowers are ridiculous and I've cut to many cords on electric ones. Mower save souch time and I have battery power left as long as I cut my grass every two weeks
customer_reviews.author: G.M.

customer_reviews.title: I would buy the single blade version
customer_reviews.text: does not cut good. but it is not worth the hassle of returning. edit 1: gave it one star from two stars. the more I use it the more I dislike it. I rescind my previous comment about buying the single blade version. I would buy neither the single or duel blade. I regret my purchase and recommend to all other to buy a gas unit.
customer_reviews.author: iCHOC

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Black and Decker with this one. Does a great job on the two lowest settings. The batteries run for about 45 minutes, just enough to do my 1/3 acre lot. Catcher bag easy to empty and replace. But it was a pain to assemble, but got it done in about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Leaves large strips of grass
customer_reviews.text: This mower leaves large strips of grass. You'll have to mow it twice if you want your yard to look nice. I assume it's because it has two small blades instead of one large one. Also, no matter how tall the grass is I can't finish mowing my medium sized yard before both of the batteries die on me. I'm surprised it has so many nice reviews. The only way I could recommend this product is if you have a townhouse with a tiny yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use Rechargeable Lawn Mower
customer_reviews.text: This is our first battery operated lawn mower. Can I say how simple this thing is to start? Our 8 year old has had a blast learning to mow. He can start and maneuver it very easily. The bag comes off easily to remove the clippings - no struggle required. The coverage is good and we have no complaints after using it weekly for the past few weeks. As for the battery we can, mlw our entire front lawn and back lawm have about 25% battery left. I'd say we have an average subdivision size. Its not tiny but its also not a corner lot.
customer_reviews.author: TRBTexas

customer_reviews.title: Broken in three places after first use...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this mower. I owned the GreenWorks corded mower for years and loved it (other than the cord). Then I saw that they came out with the ion battery version and I jumped on it. Unfortunately, it does not live up to expectation. Although I am satisfied with the mowing capability, the hardware broke in three places after the first use. Some may think I was rough with storage, but this is not the case, it has been in a shed since I bought it, eagerly awaiting my grass to come out of dormancy. See pictures below, these were caused by normal use. Very unfortunate, because I wanted to love it....
customer_reviews.author: R. Romance

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for the Older Adult with a Small Lawn...
customer_reviews.text: ...Or a larger residential lawn. I bought this for my brother-in-law living in a mobile home park. He likes it because it's quiet and easy to use. No pull-start makes it great for someone with a bad back, shoulders, or pretty much any disability that doesn't allow heavy physical labor. The only drawback, he says, is that the batteries when fully charged only last about 30 minutes, which I feel is great as it requires people who are adamant about doing it all in one shot are forced to take a break.
customer_reviews.author: Pho

customer_reviews.title: Handle folds all the way down
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never used a lawn mower before. We are very happy with this one. It took me forever to figure out how to fold the handle all the way down. The top part is easy to figure out. The bottom joints took me days to figure out. The metal handle pops out of the plastic circle to allow it to rotate down and fold. It cannot be stored vertically, I thought it could. But it now folds up under a table. It’s also really nice that it’s quiet. My husband can hear each other over the sound unlike a gas mower.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite purchase this year
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 20 inch mower. I had no idea what to expect I have never had an electric/battery mower. I've been very pleased with my purchase. I have had it for a few months now. I have a flat yard it's easy to push, it cuts evenly, I use the mulch bag it goes on and off with ease. And it's so quiet! It makes less sound than a vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Aweful Support - 2 hour Wait time
customer_reviews.text: This unit ran beautifully for 5 years. When trying to order new batteries because it the run time had decreased, I realized there was a SAFETY recall on it due to FIRE. I called the number for the recall and have been waiting for over 2 HOURS. This isn't a company support line, its a legal requirement and they don't care about service. It is a Chinese trading company, so once they have the money there isn't much incentive to service anyone except to be allowed to sell in the US. Would love to hear a response from a US based executive in charge of Customer Service.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Joliet

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut grass
customer_reviews.text: Positive: Batteries do the job for small lawns Negative: Terrible cut If you want to spend hours cutting your grass in 15 different directions to cut off all the grass stalks sticking up, this is the lawnmower is for you. Poor engineering design. Too lightweight, no blade lift. Leaves grass stalks sticking up all over the lawn. Until Grasswoks fires their incompetent engineering team I would not buy any products from them Conclusion: Wish I had not purchased. Sending unit to the dump
customer_reviews.author: Awesome Possum

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, clean...great mower.
customer_reviews.text: I've got a bigger than average lawn and this mower does it all on one charge. The blades aren't the sharpest, but they often aren't with new mowers. It cuts everything invading my lawn and powers up as needed. The "overlap" between mow lines is a little more than with some mowers, but this one is quiet, reasonably light, easy to clean, mulches well, and maneuvers well. Not self propelling, but that hasn't't been an issue here since it isn't heavy and the wheels are adequately sized. One tip: if your lawn is way overgrown, start with a high setting (there are 5), then do another pass at a shorter one.
customer_reviews.author: Runs With Pup

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: My lawn mower experience has gone from the original electric to 3 gas-guzzling versions, back to electric (which was great and functional) and now to this beauty with its rechargeable batteries. I have 2 smallish lawns and this lawn mower is perfect for the job. For the first time, mowing my lawn is not a chore as this is so easy to use. As much as I loved my electric mower, not having to play with the extension cords whilst cutting is a dream. I'm no longer being reported to the neighbourhood watch for having an unmown mini-meadow in the middle of suburbia.
customer_reviews.author: J Moore

customer_reviews.title: Think before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: The lawnmower is impressive being light, quite, interchangeable batteries no pulls and no gas to worry about. If I could do it again I would get something more rugged. In the front yard there is a street with a sidewalk. Rocks are inherently there as is tall highway grass. I hit the first rock although small it did considerable damage. It must have been the sweet spot. As for the tall grass, I was living with that’s different should have known better. I bought the extended warranty just because it is my first, but it is considered abuse. Think all the variables before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Doc 4 Cavity

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet Running!
customer_reviews.text: This mower replaces my first Greenworks 20" 40vmower purchased just over 5 years ago. Needless to say I liked it! The reason for replacing was one of the two electric motors became noisy! It ran and still cut but my wife who cuts the grass was afraid "its gonna blow up!" Couldn't find a motor online and nearest Greenworks shop about 60 miles away. So after 5 years I figured my wife deserved a new one! All the claims are true; quiet, lightweight, easy to maneuver, good battery life with quick recharging! Naturally I am keeping the old batteries for the new mower usage.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Love it but I hope the seller works with me...
customer_reviews.text: For some reason it has after one use stopped working. Charged the batteries and still. I have yet to contact the seller as I work many hours at this time but I hope I can return it and maybe get a new one. I love the machine itself. Its lightweight and easy to maneuver. Perfect for someone with a metal plate in her neck like myself. I hope I can work with the seller I can no longer use the conventional gas operated mowers, its too hard to pull the starter.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Snovel

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I actually like the mower. However after one year it quit. I have been trying to get in touch with Greenworks for the past 16 days and have no success. I was on hold for over an hour with no one coming on the line. Filled out their on line request and still have not heard back from then. With their big push for Fathers Day on Facebook, it appears I am not a one off. One person has been waiting for 3 months. Again, love the mower, but you are on your own to get it fixed even within the warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it so much but unfortunately after using it three ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like it so much but unfortunately after using it three times I am going to return it. The cut is horrible even with a sharp edge the yard just looks terrible when I am finished. The smaller battery must be defective the charger says it's charged but it doesn't run the mower nor do the battery bar on it shows no charge. All in all I think I will just stick to a reliable gas mower. Suggest you do the same
customer_reviews.author: nplotner

customer_reviews.title: Great mower
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, works well, cuts well, not too heavy to push. Cuts average size front yard, back yard easily and then the two batteries still have enough charge left to take out and do edging & trimming with the other Greenworks tools. So much cleaner and easier to use than a fuel mower, I didn't think it would work as well as a corded mower but it does. I do think the larger battery that this mower has is needed, especially if you tend to let your grass get a bit long, which we do.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Good cut... If you don't mind lots of trips with the bag
customer_reviews.text: The twin blades work well overall but with the mulch block this mower gets clogged way too easily, the bag is a pretty small one for the mower but it does appear to be sized for small yards only. Wish I had looked deeper in before buying it as I take an average of 10 to 12 times emptying the bag to clear the yard and can't use the mulch block. It does cut well for me and is eco friendly so I won't trash it... But think I'll size up to a bigger company next time.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Claypool

customer_reviews.title: battery time could be better
customer_reviews.text: Good thing this came with two batteries because when the grass is long the 4ah doesn't finish my lawn. I can put both batteries but the change gives me a break. The other reviews mention the mohawk effect which I got only when the grass was really high and I didn't overlap enough. I'd get the same with a gas mower but this requires more overlap. It's easy to switch from bag to mulch. I do have to empty bag or the weight gets too much in the back. I'm quite pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Larz Fam

customer_reviews.title: Light, quiet cuts great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mower for my 73 year old sister that lives alone and is very conscious of preserving the earth and reducing polution. She was paying a neighbor $20 to mow her small yard every two weeks and was so excited to receive this mower from her little brother. She assembled it herself and showed all of her neighbors how quiet it is, light it is, cuts great and doesn't pollute the air. She absolutely loved this mower and she saves $40 a month by mowing herself. It's the first mower she has ever had and she named it Thommy after me.
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Loved GreenWorks products for a long time. My first purchase was about 5-6 years ago [battery operated chainsaw]. Powerful, long lasting battery both use time and general longevity. Company customer service is dependable for question answers, Suggestions, remedies, warranty and repair response. Other battery power tools I have are from Black & Decker{satisfied], Skil [satisfied], DeWalt [satified] Bosch [satisfied]....I would judge GreenWorks equivalent to any of these
customer_reviews.author: Steven T. Selman

customer_reviews.title: Great job, easy to use, and convenient to fold and store away
customer_reviews.text: I got this mower a couple of weeks ago and finally got brave enough to put it together and give it a try. Ohmygawd it’s so easy and does a fantastic job. I haven’t mowed a yard in 15 years and you can’t even tell I’m out of practice. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Light weight, strong on even terrain
customer_reviews.text: I was super impressed with this. It kicks ass. I just opened it up out of the box today. I charged up the two batteries, put the batteries in the lawnmower and I was off to the races. This thing is really quiet and doesn’t make a lot of noise which is really cool. I was surprised how well it dealt with uneven terrain in really tall grass. It’s so smooth and light weight. It was so easy to push, was as smooth as butter. It’s so great to have a lawnmower that has zero reliance on foreign oil. So great to not have to pay for gas all summer long. I really recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Rachel K

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 1 year, buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year of use the batteries charge have significantly decreased, and today halfway through my yard the key melted and got stuck on the mower connection. I will try to see what their 4 year warranty is all about, it also states that the customer is reponsible for transportation of unit. My mower does not start anymore, will update about their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: YudiBoy

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, light, decent battery life
customer_reviews.text: Battery life and range don't seem to be quite what they advertise, but they might be expecting a thinner yard than what I have. You can get best battery life using the bagger and emptying frequently. Still, the mower is very light, maneuverable, and quiet. I can listen to music on my phone while mowing at the same volume I do in a quiet room. It also mows evenly and consistently (provided your battery isn't low). In addition, many rechargeable mowers have backup battery slots that just hold the backup so you can switch out when the first dies. This one has a backup battery slot that automatically starts powering the mower once the first battery dies. Really great.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Buehler

customer_reviews.title: Worked once, wont even start a week later...
customer_reviews.text: It worked well the first time I used it. Unfortunately it doesn't start now. I've had it 2 weeks and I've gotten one use out if the mower. The batteries are showing that they are both fully charged so it's got to be a problem with the mower. Kinda pricey for a disposable tool. I am never buying greenworks again.
customer_reviews.author: Will L

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a mower for a small area and had enough of gas. So far, after a few cuttings, this one has worked exactly as claimed and has no trouble with most grass and weeds, plus running over sticks, etc. If the lawn gets long it does slow down and use more battery power, but that's the nature of the device! Switches automatically between batteries, light enough for men or women to push around, cuts a nice swath. I read some of the negative reviews and simply don't understand what the users are griping about. If I had any kind of complaint it's simply that the assembly instructions could have been better. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: openreels

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased
customer_reviews.text: Amazon had a daily deal on this and in an attempt to stay "green" I purchased it for my 7000 sq ft property last May. I'm able to complete the yard using both batteries if I hurry, but I've got another battery for a blower I can use if the Florida weather gets too rough. It does tend to miss some single blades of grass if I move too quickly and if I feel picky I'll double over some areas. It's nice not having the vibrations and noise, and overall, I'm pleased with the effectiveness of the mower. I stayed with the Greenworks brand to purchase the leave blower and string trimmer so there are no issues with battery usage.
customer_reviews.author: DLB

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Does a pretty good job although the two little blades do not cut quite as cleanly as a big blade swinging around on the end of a gas engine. Although this mower is not self-propelled, it is very light and easy to operate. Catcher has a good capacity and is well designed and easy to handle. The larger battery has plenty of juice to do a good sized lawn. It is very quiet. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. David A. Himes

customer_reviews.title: Nice job!
customer_reviews.text: Returned first one because it appeared used. Got the second one and it also appeared used! Batteries in too small ziplock bags, no plastic on battery doors... kept it because grass was getting higher. First time out, it performed flawlessly! Cut front, back and both sides, less than .25 acres of grass and fresh cut twigs one one battery. I was surprised at the power for its light weight. The auto engine speed is a huge plus to power thru grass clumps and small branches. Very quiet and very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Way overrated
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this made it into the top 10, 2 moters, 2 blades run time is less than comparable Worx of the same voltage, does not cut near as well, maybe it mulches better, At a $170.00 more all yet get is a different color and porrer cutting. I have had a Worx with intellicut and it way out performed this unit. I have cut the same lawn with this, a Worx intellicut and a Worx 14 " 40 volt, I would return this if It was not outside the return window and keep running my Worx instead. of the 3 I will buy a Worx with the intellicut next time around.
customer_reviews.author: Ghostraveler

customer_reviews.title: A Great Mower
customer_reviews.text: I've now had this mower for 3 years and really use it alot. It's held up nicely and the batteries are still good. It does better even than described for deeper grasses than just a regular lawn. We liked the product's dependability so much I bought the weedwacker and hedge trimmer from Greenworks also . And you can swap batteries - a bonus. So, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: brewstout

customer_reviews.title: Buy this mower!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower! So easy to assemble, easy to use, cuts like a dream! I love the three cutting levels. It’s lightweight, my backyard has some nasty slopes. Easily mowed street grass, two front lawns side and back lawn on one charge. It’s powerful and rugged, copes easily with the uneven coarse terrain of my backyard - in fact way better than my old gas powered mower did! So far, no complaints, only accolades and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Fabbritboy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Batteries do not charge
customer_reviews.text: Great product if the batteries worked and don't expect any help from customer service. The batteries have to "cool off" for about an hour before you can charge them. I have many battery-powered tools from different companies and these are the only ones that have to rest like this. Unless you have about a quarter of an acre, you'll be mowing in segments. I'm told by customer service this is normal battery operation and there is nothing that can be done.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Jett

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Powered Mower
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait a few months and use this mower before reviewing it. So far it has exceeded my expectations. It is very light, maneuverable and easy to operate. I have use it in mulching and bagging modes, both work very well. Pros: no need for oil, gasoline or spark plugs. It start with the push of a button. Dual battery allows for over and hour of normal mowing. Batteries can be used with other equipment, chain saw, line trimmer, blower ... etc. Cons: not quite as powerful as a gas mower, taller grass requires slowing down your speed. It still will go through it, it just takes longer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Foley

customer_reviews.title: quiet, powerful, peaceful mowing.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. I can't use gas mowers, because of the fumes, so I was wondering how well this would work out. if you have never turned on an electric mower (or one with an electric start) you will be in for a treat. Pros: -Startup (push a button... no yanking) -Quiet (can almost talk over it at a normal volume) -Light -Powerful (it mows through small trees) -Adjustable -Large Bag Cons: -Battery life The battery life is huge and lasts a long time, and if you have a single lot, this should be more than enough. If not, get another big battery.
customer_reviews.author: Super Conqerors

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cordless Mower
customer_reviews.text: We did ALOT of research before buying a cordless mower and based on reviews and research we picked this one. It works great we have a large city yard with lots of weeds and tall grass and this mower worked great and still had a lot of charge after 60 minutes of mowing. Assembly so so easy to like 5-10 minutes, it is very light weight, easy to maneuver, very quiet and just overall a great mower. We are also happy we have 2 batteries as well as we will be buying other greenworks products. So happy with our investment purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've used it twice now, and I'm really liking it. It's not as loud as a traditional mower and does a great job. If you have a log of irregular turns to negotiate it may be slightly bothersome just because there are two blades that are slightly offset. While getting used to it, I find myself having to back up after a turn to make sure I don't miss any lawn. However, for me this is still a great product despite that minor note on maneuverability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lasted 19 months
customer_reviews.text: it's a great mower when it works. has the mulching attachment that does a great job of cutting the grass up so you don't have to bag and dump it. it's quiet enough, i don't need gas or oil for it, it was a nice lawnmower. but it stopped working after 1.5 summers. one of my blades doesn't spin freely so the mower won't start. it cost me $17/month to own it, which is still cheaper than paying for a yard service, but i think my mower should last longer than 19 months. hopefully they've changed whatever design flaw caused this malfunction
customer_reviews.author: Fred Flintstone

customer_reviews.title: Good mower overall; needs better battery option
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good mower. The 4.0AH and 2.0AH battery together are wildly insufficient to finish both my front and back yards (maybe 2,000 sq ft combined), but swapping out the 2.0AH for a 5.0AH battery purchased elsewhere on this website enables me to easily mow both with plenty of capacity to spare. It's a heavy mower, but the higher AH battery combo seems to make it significantly easier to push. The mulching function is not great - I think I was expecting the cut grass to scatter evenly but instead it is left in rows - but that's a small consideration. In all, a good alternative to a gas-powered or corded mower.
customer_reviews.author: Patris

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived on time and in great condition
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that I, a senior woman, no longer has to guy gasoline and can operate the mower with little to no effort. I can mow my yard in the same amount of time as I did with the old gas mower that was self propelled. This mower is so lightweight that it takes so little effort to use. I love how quiet the motor is. I did not mow my yard with the gas mower until I thought my other senior neighbors were awake for fear of disturbing them so early. Now I can start as early as I like.
customer_reviews.author: Annette A.

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 seasons
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mower spring of 2018. Exactly 2 years later and one of the motors has a bad bearing. Making a terrible scraping howling sound. I was worried about this mower from the start. If you look at the motors from under the mower you can see right into the motor and the windings are exposed. All that grass and moisture can go right inside. Not surprised that it failed. Update 3/11/2020. Reported the issue to Greenworks and they are sending me a new mower. Great customer service. Raised to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Larson

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Instructions and Help Line Shut Down
customer_reviews.text: I use the lawnmower to mow a smallish part of my lawn. It does seem to work. BUT it was supplied with a "large" and "small" battery. The small battery does not fit anywhere I could find on the mower. I called to see if there was a reason and they said that covid-19 prevented phone calls. Please send an e-mail. i did that, and it bounced right back. Until this company gets its act together, I would not recommend the mower.
customer_reviews.author: George H. Conklin

customer_reviews.title: Better than a corded mower?
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Battery powered. Can do my yard(1/4 acre) just before both batteries die. It isn’t loud compared to a gas mower, it sounds like a giant bee hive. It’s my yard vacuum cleaner. It is weaker than a standard mower.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy groves

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Remorse: Unimpressive Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I typically don't do negative reviews, but for the cost I'm a bit disappointed in the machine. The batteries do not last long enough to do less than a .25 acre lot. It could be due to the hot temperatures in the Midwest. Northern states with cooler temperatures may fair better. With replacement batteries running at $65 you could buy a higher end gas mower for the cost of the mower and a few additional batteries. If you still want to green still, I recommend a corded mower. The mower worked great until it started to reach the high 80's with high humidity. Recommend Corded for performance.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really love this mower! I live out of town and have a service come in on a regular basis but there are areas I like to give special care. I’m not young and don’t want to mess with gas and a lot of maintenance. This is perfect, just recharge battery after use and a little clean up and you’ll be ready for the next time you need to mow. Thinking about their small tiller now.
customer_reviews.author: nmckee

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Only Two Years
customer_reviews.text: This was a initially a great, lightweight, push-button start, no-gas mower. I have a small yard with some seemingly, small hills until you have to push a lawn mower up or down them. The mower initially worked pretty well until year 3 when I found I was having to mow the same areas over and over again. I thought, well, maybe the blades need sharpened, so I had them sharpened, but it did not help. Had to buy a new mower for year 3. Now after sitting in my garage for a couple of years, it won't work at all. The batteries and charger are still good though and they work with my weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Doerr

customer_reviews.title: Batteries won't hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device a year ago. I may have used it 50 times at most. Now the batteries won't hold a charge. I mow a part of a small yard and both batteries die. So I have to wait for the batteries to cool down, recharge them before I can finish. The worse part: the batteries are VERY expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my mower from Amazon and only received the smaller of the two batteries that I was to receive. The one battery I did get only lasts about 20 minutes on a full charge, major pain! The mower also arrives with some minor scratches, Amazon pleasantly gave me a discount due to damage. Amazon couldn't furnish me the missing battery and referred me to greenworks directly. I contacted them 3 times with absolutely no response at all. I will never purchase a greenworks product again!
customer_reviews.author: Malisa

customer_reviews.title: Needs blades for a 22" cut
customer_reviews.text: Had this mower for a while now and I mostly really like it. As some reviews have said, it leaves a strip in the middle. I looked underneath and the blades are too short to overlap but I'm going to try getting slightly longer blades. Even with that, it's convenient enough that I'll give it 4 stars. If the longer blades aren't too much for it, probably worth 5 stars -- but I shouldn't have to be buying longer blades.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Hood

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I bought Greenworks tools in the past and they were great. This lawnmower has been a disappointment. The first one I got didn't hold a charge long enough to cut a 1400 SQ ft lawn so I returned it. The second one is not cutting the lawn and leaving patches of uncut grass. This has been a disappointment and I will probably pause before buying Greenworks again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Hassay

customer_reviews.title: Great Mower and better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm a senior citizen and I've mowed a lot of yards. I was not sure if this electric would cut clean or just beat my grass to death like an electric I triad a few years ago. The Greenworks cut cleanly and evenly with power to spare. I wouldn't recommend it for a half acre lawn but it sure took care my lawn. No gas, no oil, no noise!!! UPDATE: Still running great. Waited to long to mow this week and the grass was high and thick. The mower plowed through without a problem. In the video I was pushing it one handed.
customer_reviews.author: Florida_Lawdog

customer_reviews.title: Electric lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: The batteries die in a short time. On 3rd charge and only a small amount of grass cut..very frustrating..maybe defective from day 1..
customer_reviews.author: Barbara D.

customer_reviews.title: Mower and warranty both broken
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had to do 2 warranty claims with Greenworks on this mower. The first one was circuit board and they replaced and paid the labor with little problem. The second one (motor ceased up) they claimed they were shipping me a replacement mower and it has yet to arrive and all they can tell me is that the warehouse is behind and they don’t know when it will ship. I liked the mower when it was working. Greenworks has definitely dropped the ball when it comes to honoring their warranty
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I do recommend this lan mower
customer_reviews.text: Very light & efficient at cutting Bermuda grass. I do recommend this lan mower. However, I do have on pet peeve. It is not the best at vacuuming live oak leaves. When I pass over the areas where the live oak leaves have fallen, there is not enough resistance to cause the blades to speed fast enough to pick up the slightly denser & heavier small leaves. It would be nice to have the ability to manually speed up the blades so it may vacuum leaves more efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Mdtracy

customer_reviews.title: A couple issues after only four months.
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting tired of having to reassemble the grass catcher. The top and bottom snap together by design, but they've come apart about every other time I've used the mower. This is certainly the biggest problem I've encountered so far. But, I see a developing problem. After only four months of light duty, the cushioned grip on the handlebar is splitting. Not much question, within another season I will not have a cushioned grip. Other than these two issues, the mower seems to perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Victor in PC

customer_reviews.title: A great mower for light lawn work.
customer_reviews.text: Going from a traditional gas mower, there is quite a bit to like here: It's quieter, lighter, easier to handle, easier to start, cleaner and I don't have to worry about gas or oil. All of those things are great... BUT... the trade off is in a big drop in power. You'll have problems getting through areas that are even a little bit overgrown. Not saying you can't do it, but you won't be able to just plow through it like you can with a gas mower.
customer_reviews.author: Angus_McCool

customer_reviews.title: A fine starter mower but plan for an upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I got this mower when I became a first time home owner with no prior experience managing a lawn. Three years later, I can safely say this is a fine mower to start with. The 2 AH battery is utterly useless, investing in a 5 or 6 AH battery has allowed me to mow my lawn without a recharge stop. However, while this is a fine mower to start, I would recommend preparing to budget for a upgrade mower. The mulch plug clogs too easily, the cuts aren't even and I have a hill in my front lawn that it is just not designed to handle. Overall, a solid starter mower but I intend to get an EGO next time.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for convenience. It became inconvenient that I couldn't complete my lawn in one sitting bc one battery port on the mower crapped out and I was constantly waiting for batteries to charge. And then I would have to weed-eat a different day bc I was relying on the same 3 batteries. dumb.
customer_reviews.author: M3ow

product_meta.title: Greenworks 40V 20-Inch Cordless Twin Force Lawn Mower, 4Ah & 2Ah Batteries with Charger Included
product_meta.description: Size:4Ah and 2Ah Battery and Charger| Style:20" 40VOur GREENWORKS 40V Dual Blade/Dual Battery Port Mower is perfect for yards up to 1/3 Acre with a total battery run-time of approximate 70 minutes. The G-Max 40V is a dual blade mower designed to deliver better mulching, cutting and bagging. The Dual Battery Port automatically switches to the backup battery for a longer run-time, making it easier to get the job done. All this without the hassle of gas, cords or maintenance. One-Battery fits all of our 40 Volt System that includes over 40+ tools to choose from (tools not included). Deck Material: Plastic, Deck Type: Stamped
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes: G-max 25302 Lawn mower (push button start & dual blades), battery charger, a 4Ah and 2Ah batteries

Dual battery ports with automatic switch-over for longer, uninterrupted run-times. Get an approximate runtime of 70 minutes using both batteries. Run-Time varies based on grass condition and operator technique

20-inch cutting deck offers a balance of maneuverability and cutting capacity making it ideal for mid-sized areas, while dual blades offer better cut quality, superior mulching and bagging capabilities
Item's weight is 42.5 lbs. Includes 10 in. rear wheels and 7 in. front wheels for easy maneuver. Use the lever to reach up to 5 height positions, for cutting range of 1-3/4' to 3-3/8'
Innovative Smart Cut technology adjust for power or runtime based on the thickness of your grass. Hard top rear bag indicates when the bag is full and needs to be emptied

Compatible with Greenworks G-MAX 40V Li-Ion System that powers more than 40 tools (not included). Kindly review the user manual under technical specification for troubleshooting steps and set up instructions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,715 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
